title: Paytm posts first-ever profit helped by ticketing biz sale to Zomato; revenue down 34% YoY
description: The sale of Paytm Insider resulted in a one-time gain of Rs 1,345 crore for the company in the quarter ended September 30, helping it swing to a profit from a year-earlier loss of Rs 291 crore and taking its cash balance to Rs 9,990 crore.
content: Paytm parent One 97 Communications on Tuesday posted a 34% year-on-year fall in second-quarter operational revenue at Rs 1,660 crore, but the sale of its ticketing platform to Zomato helped the digital payments company report a net profit of Rs 930 crore.The sale of Paytm Insider resulted in a one-time gain of Rs 1,345 crore for the company in the quarter ended September 30, helping it swing to a profit from a year-earlier loss of Rs 291 crore and taking its cash balance to Rs 9,990 crore. Its operational revenue in the second quarter of last fiscal year was Rs 2,518 crore.Consumer biz stagnationIn terms of customer engagement, Paytm has lost a big chunk of its users following its shift to a third-party payment application model and due to a central bank-imposed embargo on its banking business. It had 68 million monthly transacting users the quarter through September was 68 million, compared with 78 million in the previous quarter.The company said it is working to reactivate the user base of the 135 million customers who had UPI handles with Paytm but have been migrated to the four new banks, after the Reserve Bank of India ordered Paytm Payments Bank to stop providing banking services.
